column1: The name is a modernisation of the [[Old English]] ''Upburnan'' as would represent [[Rohirric]].<ref name="Nomen"/>
It derives from the fact that the hamlet was some way "up" the river Snowbourn.<ref name="Nomen"/>

column2: ''up-'' is used in English place-names for river-side villages (as [[wikipedia:Upavon|Upavon]] in [[wikipedia:Wiltshire|Wiltshire]])
